report.title: Explore distinct species 3 using index_locations_samples
report.description: Report designed for species lists used in the explore records facility in iRecord. Second version has additional parameters. This version depends on the Spatial Index Builder module to index the list of locations that users can set in their preferences as their locality, for significantly improved performance.
report.query: SELECT distinct #columns# FROM cache_occurrences_functional o JOIN cache_taxa_taxon_lists cttl ON cttl.id=o.taxa_taxon_list_id #agreements_join# #joins# WHERE #sharing_filter# AND ('#record_status#'<>'' OR (o.record_status not in ('I','T') AND (#ownData#=1 OR o.record_status not in ('D','R')))) AND ('#searchArea#'='' OR st_intersects(o.public_geom, ST_MakeValid(st_geomfromtext('#searchArea#',900913)))) AND (#ownData#=0 OR CAST(o.created_by_id AS character varying)='#currentUser#') #idlist#

param.name: smpattrs
param.description: Comma separated list of sample attribute IDs to include as columns in the report

param.name: occattrs
param.description: Comma separated list of occurrence attribute IDs to include as columns in the report

param.name: idlist
param.description: Comma separated list of occurrence IDs to filter to.

param.name: currentUser
param.description: Current user's warehouse ID. Allows a column to be output indicating that the user owns the record.

param.name: location_id
param.description: Provide the location to display records for

param.name: ownLocality
param.join: JOIN index_locations_samples lfilter ON lfilter.sample_id=o.sample_id and lfilter.location_id=#location_id#

param.name: taxon_groups
param.description: List of taxon group IDs to view data for

param.name: ownGroups
param.join: JOIN taxon_groups tgfilter ON tgfilter.id=o.taxon_group_id AND ('#taxon_groups#'='0' OR tgfilter.id IN (#taxon_groups#))

param.name: survey_id
param.description: Select the survey, or leave for all surveys

param.name: date_from
param.where: ('#date_from#'='Click here' OR o.date_end >= CAST(COALESCE('#date_from#','1500-01-01') as date))

param.name: date_to
param.where: ('#date_to#'='Click here' OR o.date_start <= CAST(COALESCE('#date_to#','1500-01-01') as date))

param.name: user_filter
param.description: Use this to filter the list to a warehouse user ID other than the current user
